So, it can not keep stream from your chrome browser if you computer goes to sleep. some of the reviewer has said earlier that no need to keep your computer running (totally wrong)4. It description does not mentions WiFi bandwidth requirements, Most important aspect is being missed.5. Chrome browser itself is an an issues, it limits video steaming from certain webpages.6. Its only good for pre-installed apps (which is now a days available in every Roku, SmartTV, or Blue-ray player) only..

review: Configuration was pretty easy, but video was choppy.  I tried using it to watch Amazon Videos and NFL Game Rewind games.  But even at its peak framerate, it wasn't very smooth (especially when the on-screen action got heavy).  I ended up getting a Fire TV and demoted this device to the shelf.  Maybe I can give it away to someone.

review: Google Chromecast makes watching Netflix movies or YouTube so easy. The picture is crystal clear. The set up is very easy. Just follow the instructions that come along in the box. Once set up you want to make sure that you connect to Chromecast from your device before playing a movie, etc. That was a well spent $35.
